message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Typhoid fever is caused by Salmonella typhi, which contains Lipid A in its outer membrane. Lipid A is a potent endotoxin responsible for the toxic symptoms seen in this patient. Pili, flagella, and outer capsules are not typically associated with the toxic symptoms of typhoid fever.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Typhoid fever is caused by Salmonella typhi, which has a toxic component called Lipid A present in the bacterial cell wall. This toxic component is responsible for the fever, chills, and other symptoms presented by the patient. Pili, flagella, and outer capsule are not typically associated with the toxic symptoms of typhoid fever.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Typhoid fever is caused by Salmonella typhi bacteria, which have Lipid A as a toxic component present in its cell wall. This causes the fever, fatigue, and other symptoms in the patient as the immune system tries to eliminate the bacteria.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Lipid A is a component of the bacterial cell wall and is responsible for causing endotoxic shock, which can result in fever, chills, and other toxic symptoms. The other options listed are not directly responsible for the toxic symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Typhoid fever is caused by the bacterium Salmonella typhi and its symptoms are caused by Lipid A, a toxic component present in the bacterial cell wall. The other cellular components do not play a major role in the toxic symptoms of typhoid fever.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Typhoid fever is caused by Salmonella typhi, which has lipid A as a toxic component present in the bacterial cell wall. Pili, flagella and outer capsule are not directly responsible for the toxic symptoms in this case.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Typhoid fever is caused by the bacterium Salmonella enterica serotype Typhi, which has Lipid A as a toxic component present in the bacterial cell wall. This is responsible for the patient's symptoms of fevers with chills, fatigue, diarrhea, and loss of appetite. The other options are components of the bacterial cell surface but are not directly involved in causing toxic symptoms in typhoid fever.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Typhoid fever is caused by Salmonella enterica serotype typhi, and Lipid A is the toxic component present in the bacterial cell wall of Gram-negative bacteria, including Salmonella.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Typhoid fever is caused by Salmonella typhi, which has Lipid A, a toxic component present in the bacterial cell wall, responsible for the toxic symptoms such as fever, diarrhea, and loss of appetite.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Typhoid fever is caused by Salmonella typhi which has a toxic component present in the bacterial cell wall called Lipid A. This component is responsible for the toxic symptoms experienced by the patient, including fevers with chills, fatigue, diarrhea, and loss of appetite.
